accessibility.title: Accessibility Statement
accessibility.intro: Bigtablet, Inc. is committed to ensuring digital accessibility for all users.

1.title: 1. Our Commitment
1.content: We aim to conform to WCAG 2.1 Level AA standards.

2.title: 2. Measures We Take
2.content: We test regularly, provide alt text, maintain contrast, and ensure keyboard access.

3.title: 3. Ongoing Efforts
3.content: Accessibility improvements are continuous and ongoing.

4.title: 4. Third-Party Content
4.content: We cannot control third-party content but encourage partners to support accessibility.

5.title: 5. Feedback
5.content: We welcome feedback about accessibility barriers.

6.title: 6. Alternative Access
6.content: If you experience difficulties, we will provide information via alternative means.

cookies.title: Cookie Policy
cookies.intro: This Cookie Policy explains how Bigtablet, Inc. uses cookies and tracking technologies.

1.title: 1. What Are Cookies?
1.content: Cookies are small text files stored on your device by a website.

2.title: 2. Types of Cookies We Use
2.content: We use Strictly Necessary, Performance, Functional, and Targeting/Advertising cookies.

3.title: 3. How We Use Cookies
3.content: We use cookies to operate and secure the site, analyze traffic, remember preferences, and provide personalized content.

4.title: 4. Third-Party Cookies
4.content: Third parties may place cookies and collect browsing information.

5.title: 5. Your Choices
5.content: You can manage cookies via browser settings or opt-out tools. CCPA residents may use our opt-out page.

6.title: 6. Updates to This Policy
6.content: We may update this Cookie Policy. Changes will be posted with an updated Effective Date.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: Bigtablet, Inc. (‚ÄúCompany,‚Äù ‚Äúwe,‚Äù ‚Äúour,‚Äù or ‚Äúus‚Äù) is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our website and services. By using our website, you agree to the terms of this Privacy Policy.

1.title: 1. Introduction
1.content: We explain the scope of this policy and the services it covers, including our website and related offerings.

2.title: 2. Information We Collect
2.content: Personal Information You Provide, Automatically Collected Information, and Information from Third Parties.

3.title: 3. How We Use Your Information
3.content: We use your information to provide, operate, and improve services; communicate with you; personalize experiences; conduct analytics; comply with legal obligations; and offer marketing.

4.title: 4. How We Share Your Information
4.content: We do not sell personal information. We may share with service providers, for legal compliance, and in business transfers.

5.title: 5. Cookies and Tracking
5.content: We use cookies and similar technologies for sessions, analytics, personalization, and advertising. You may disable cookies, but some features may not function properly.

6.title: 6. Data Retention
6.content: We retain personal information as long as necessary for business or legal obligations.

7.title: 7. Your Rights Under CCPA
7.content: You have the Right to Know, Right to Delete, Right to Opt-Out, and Right to Non-Discrimination. Contact mailmaster@bigtablet.kr or +1 (408) 393-1827.

8.title: 8. Data Security
8.content: We implement reasonable measures such as encryption and access controls, though no system is 100% secure.

9.title: 9. Children‚Äôs Privacy
9.content: We do not knowingly collect data from children under 13. If discovered, we will delete it.

10.title: 10. International Users
10.content: Data may be transferred to and stored in the United States, where data protection laws may differ from those of your country.

11.title: 11. Changes to This Policy
11.content: We may update this Privacy Policy. Material changes will be posted with an updated Effective Date.

12.title: 12. Unauthorized Email Collection Prohibited
12.content: The email addresses published on this website are for the exclusive use of our customers and business partners. Unauthorized collection of email addresses by any means (including email harvesting software or other automatic tools) is strictly prohibited. Violators may be subject to legal action under applicable laws.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.intro: Welcome to Bigtablet, Inc. These Terms of Service govern your access to and use of our website, products, and services.

1.title: 1. Eligibility
1.content: You must be at least 13 years old to use our services.

2.title: 2. Use of Services
2.content: Use our services only for lawful purposes. Do not attempt unauthorized access, interfere with, or harm the Services.

3.title: 3. Accounts
3.content: Provide accurate and complete information. Keep your credentials secure, and you are responsible for all activities under your account.

4.title: 4. Intellectual Property
4.content: All content, trademarks, and intellectual property on this site are owned by or licensed to Bigtablet, Inc.

5.title: 5. User Content
5.content: You retain ownership of the content you submit, but grant Bigtablet, Inc. a license to use it as needed to provide services.

6.title: 6. Prohibited Conduct
6.content: Do not violate any laws, infringe intellectual property rights, distribute malware, or harass other users.

7.title: 7. Third-Party Services
7.content: Our services may include links or access to third-party websites or tools. We are not responsible for their content or policies.

8.title: 8. Disclaimers
8.content: The services are provided 'as is' without any warranties, express or implied, including merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose.

9.title: 9. Limitation of Liability
9.content: Bigtablet, Inc. shall not be liable for indirect, incidental, or consequential damages arising from your use of the services.

10.title: 10. Indemnification
10.content: You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Bigtablet, Inc. from any claims, damages, or expenses arising from your violation of these Terms.

11.title: 11. Termination
11.content: We may suspend or terminate your access if you violate these Terms or engage in prohibited behavior.

12.title: 12. Governing Law
12.content: These Terms are governed by and construed under the laws of the State of California, without regard to conflict of law principles.

13.title: 13. Changes to These Terms
13.content: We may modify or update these Terms of Service at any time. Continued use of our services constitutes acceptance of the updated Terms.

banner.title: Vision Beyond Pixels
banner.description:
Our service goes beyond video analysis 
to create real value. 

With AI-powered technology, we deliver 
instant solutions for theft prevention, 
industrial safety, and marketing optimization. 

Unlike conventional services that take about 
two weeks to analyze, our patented technology 
compresses video by up to 97%, 
enabling real-time response.

problem.title:
The Challenge
 We Address
problem.description:
As offline stores regain attention and experiential spaces expand, theft has become a growing concern.

Traditional RFID tags and video surveillance solutions often face high costs and frequent malfunctions, limiting their effectiveness.

To address this, we developed a patented real-time AI video analysis technology.

By applying neural network‚Äìbased video compression, we process high-resolution data efficiently and deliver real-time insights into customer flow, interests, and behavior patterns.

1.title: Retail Analytics
1.description: Analyze customer movement, dwell time, and product interests to optimize store operations and boost sales.

2.title: Retail Security
2.description: Prevent theft using RFID tags, CCTV, and security gates, with real-time detection of suspicious activity.

3.title: Smart Factory Safety
3.description: Detect and respond to risks in factories using sensors and AI.

4.title: Parking Control System
4.description: Smart parking management with license plate recognition and barriers.

5.title: Marketing Optimization
5.description: Utilize real-time insights to enhance customer engagement and improve marketing strategies.

section1.title:
Beyond the pixels, 
we see the bigger 
world
section1.description:
Bigtablet goes beyond simple AI video analysis. 
We enhance the value of our clients and further 
support their sustainable growth through effective 
marketing strategies.

section2.title:
Endless reflection 
and thought elevate 
our value
section2.description:
At Bigtablet, our team constantly reflects, questions, and refines.
Through this process, we strive to provide clients and users with more convenient and
 tailored analytics services.
We go beyond simple data collection and analysis, moving forward each day in pursuit of the deeper value that lies beyond.

team.title: The People of Bigtablet
team.description: Introducing the team shaping the future of bigtablet together.

CEO.name: Jiho Moon
CEO.description: An adventurer in pursuit of optimal efficiency

qa1.q: Hello, Mr. Jiho Moon! Could you please give us a brief self-introduction?
qa1.a: My name is Jiho Moon, the CEO of Bigtablet. I began my professional career a bit earlier than most, driven by my curiosity and eagerness to explore various fields. Once I‚Äôm interested in something, I study and learn until I truly understand it. Looking back, my early start in the professional world, combined with this curiosity-driven mindset, has shaped who I am today. It‚Äôs also what has allowed me to work with Bigtablet for the past three years without giving up until problems were solved.

qa2.q: Could you briefly describe your current responsibilities at Bigtablet?
qa2.a: In many ways, I oversee nearly everything at Bigtablet from start to finish. My main responsibilities focus on defining the company‚Äôs direction, ensuring sustainable growth, and setting strategies to reach our future milestones.

qa3.q: What inspired you to start your own company?
qa3.a: Many people think entrepreneurship is only for experts in a specific field or those with a revolutionary idea. For me, it was more about identifying problems and finding fulfillment in solving them. Seeing the company grow as a result of our collective efforts has been deeply rewarding. That‚Äôs why I no longer see Bigtablet as just a company I founded in college, but as a true partner in solving real-world challenges.

qa4.q: What kind of company would you like Bigtablet to become in the future?
qa4.a: My goal is to grow Bigtablet from a startup into a global AI solutions company. Together with our talented team members, I want to build upon our strong company culture and establish Bigtablet as an influential, specialized leader in the global market.

qa5.q: What do you think is the biggest advantage of working at Bigtablet?
qa5.a: I believe the greatest advantage is the opportunity to grow together in a fast-evolving organization. It‚Äôs not only about professional growth ‚Äî it‚Äôs about the synergy created when people from different backgrounds come together, share knowledge, and learn from each other. Of course, our employee benefits are also quite nice!

qa6.q: Lastly, do you have any words for your current and future team members?
qa6.a: Bigtablet is currently on a steep growth trajectory. With rapid growth often come challenges and areas for improvement, but I want to express my sincere gratitude to everyone who has been part of this journey. To future team members, I look forward to working with passionate individuals who want to make history together in the AI industry. Thank you!

CTO.name: Minho Park
CTO.description: An engineer driven to change the world through technology

qa1.q: Hello Minho! Could you please introduce yourself briefly?
qa1.a: Hello, I‚Äôm Minho Park, currently leading research and development at BigTablet.

qa2.q: The title of CTO might sound unfamiliar to some. Could you tell us what it means and what your role involves?
qa2.a: CTO stands for Chief Technology Officer ‚Äî the person responsible for overseeing a company‚Äôs overall technology strategy and execution. At BigTablet, I lead the development of our AI CCTV solutions and various R&D initiatives, managing both internal and external collaborative projects. I‚Äôm also in charge of technical administration such as preparing R&D proposals, writing reports, and handling intellectual property. In essence, a CTO bridges technology and business strategy to drive company growth.

qa3.q: Could you tell us a bit about what you‚Äôre currently developing at BigTablet?
qa3.a: We‚Äôre developing a platform for video AI analytics based on VCM ‚Äî Video Coding for Machines. Traditional video compression focuses on what‚Äôs visually pleasing to humans, while we‚Äôre building compression optimized for AI interpretation. Our system preserves high resolution for objects of interest while reducing unnecessary background data, redundant frames, and excessive color information. This allows us to cut video size by up to 70% compared to standard codecs, while maintaining object detection and tracking accuracy. With this technology, we‚Äôre expanding into fields like smart retail and smart city solutions.

qa4.q: It must have been challenging to develop products in the early stages. What difficulties did you face?
qa4.a: Coming from a research background, joining BigTablet was my first hands-on experience in real product development. Unlike academic research, we had to design for user interface and experience, which turned out to be quite challenging. While improving algorithm performance was familiar to me, making it intuitive and usable for real users required many iterations. In the early days, limited resources and manpower meant I had to juggle development, operation, and testing at once. Prioritization and efficiency became critical. Through this, I learned to think beyond technical perfection ‚Äî considering productization and market fit together.

qa5.q: Lastly, what kind of technological vision is BigTablet pursuing?
qa5.a: Our vision is captured in the phrase ‚ÄòVision Beyond Pixels.‚Äô We aim to go beyond mere image recognition ‚Äî to interpret context and meaning beyond pixels, creating new value through technology.

qa1.q: Hello Chaehyung! Could you please introduce yourself briefly?
qa1.a: Hello, I‚Äôm Chaehyung Lee, and I‚Äôm in charge of administrative affairs at Bigtablet Inc.

qa2.q: Could you briefly introduce your role?
qa2.a:
At Bigtablet, I‚Äôm mainly responsible for operational tasks related to our ongoing projects, as well as sales and customer service support.
Since we don‚Äôt yet have a dedicated department for areas like accounting, my work often involves handling a variety of administrative tasks as needed.

In the future, I expect to focus more on customer service operations as our services continue to expand and evolve.

qa3.q: Was there a particular reason or moment that led you to join Bigtablet?
qa3.a: There wasn‚Äôt really a grand reason or turning point. Before graduation, I was looking for companies to do my field training at, and Bigtablet happened to be close by. But what really drew me was that the CEO was young ‚Äî I thought other places might feel too hierarchical or rigid. So I joined for my field training, and that connection eventually led me to stay on as an intern, and then as a full-time employee.

qa4.q: Have there been any moments when you felt, 'Ah, I‚Äôm really doing well at my job'?
qa4.a: Rather than feeling like I‚Äôm doing particularly well, I tend to feel proud whenever the company achieves progress ‚Äî like when we secure new support projects or take meaningful steps forward as a team. It‚Äôs less of a self-congratulatory feeling and more of a reminder that there‚Äôs still a lot more I want to do, a kind of mixed emotion between satisfaction and motivation.

qa5.q: How would you like to grow or what kind of role do you hope to take on in the company moving forward?
qa5.a: Most people imagine climbing to the top of a company as their goal, but that‚Äôs not really me. My motto is ‚Äòsteady and long.‚Äô I once thought about how I‚Äôd like to be like a fan ‚Äî not as powerful as an air conditioner, but still something that quietly helps others. It‚Äôs a bit of a metaphor, but I want to be someone who‚Äôs helpful and reliable, even if not always in the spotlight. (Of course, that doesn‚Äôt mean I plan to stop working hard after one season!)

qa6.q: What does Bigtablet mean to you personally?
qa6.a: At first, I thought it was a slow train, but it turned out to be an express one. Still, if I had to describe Bigtablet, I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs a lot like the moon. Sometimes it feels so big and distant, yet it radiates this quiet beauty, like a soft halo in the night sky. It‚Äôs ever-changing and full of life. Like watching the moon through a high-speed camera ‚Äî even when it‚Äôs momentarily hidden, it remains the brightest, most noticeable thing in the sky. Maybe ‚Äòthe North Star‚Äô would be a more fitting comparison, but somehow, ‚Äòthe moon‚Äô feels closer to my heart ‚Äî because it‚Äôs something I hope will keep growing and shining brighter.

PM.name: Yerim Kwon
PM.description: A product manager who sees the beauty in dreams

qa1.q: Hello Yerim! Could you please introduce yourself briefly?
qa1.a: Hi! I‚Äôm Yerim Kwon, currently working as a Product Manager at BigTablet.

qa2.q: Could you tell us a bit about your role at BigTablet?
qa2.a: As a PM, I‚Äôm responsible for performance management and supporting our development team. My main focus is to help developers stay fully immersed in their work by taking care of everything around them.

qa3.q: The title ‚ÄòPM‚Äô might sound unfamiliar to some. What exactly does a Product Manager do?
qa3.a: PM can mean many things, but in my case, it stands for Product Manager. A product manager is someone who constantly asks ‚Äòwhy‚Äô‚Äîsupporting the process of building better products that customers truly want. We connect different teams and ensure clear communication throughout development. In IT, that means coordinating with departments like planning, design, and development to define features and balance what customers want with what‚Äôs technically possible.

qa4.q: I heard you graduated from a Meister high school. What made you decide to pursue a career in IT and become a PM?
qa4.a: Ever since I was young, I dreamed of entering society early. My motto has always been ‚Äòwalk a different path.‚Äô So instead of going to college, I wanted to gain real-world experience as soon as possible. I‚Äôd always been interested in computers, so naturally I wanted to make that my profession. During my time at Meister High School, I studied web development for two years, but I realized that I truly enjoyed interacting with people and supporting projects across all areas. That‚Äôs when I decided to pursue the PM role.

qa5.q: What challenges have you faced while working as a PM?
qa5.a: There are many challenges, but automation is probably the hardest part. Automation is meant to make things more efficient, but sometimes the process itself feels inefficient or overly complicated. Still, once it‚Äôs properly set up, it can dramatically improve workflow. I often think deeply about how tasks should be structured so that my teammates can work more efficiently. That kind of problem-solving mindset has become a big part of how I approach my work.

qa6.q: Finally, what made you decide to join BigTablet, and what are your goals here?
qa6.a: Before joining BigTablet, I applied to several companies, but I often ran into obstacles like educational background and the tough job market. Since most PM roles require developer experience or internal transfers, it wasn‚Äôt easy for someone new like me. I wanted a freer, startup-style environment where I could experience everything from A to Z. So when BigTablet sent a job posting to my school, I was thrilled‚Äîit felt like destiny. I think the most valuable thing I want to achieve here is to grow together with the team. Startups evolve alongside their members, and that shared growth mirrors my own journey as a young professional. I want to keep learning and growing with BigTablet.

BE.name: Gunwoo Kim
BE.description: A developer who strives for constant growth

qa1.q: Hello Gunwoo! Could you please introduce yourself briefly?
qa1.a: Hello! I‚Äôm Gunwoo Kim, a backend developer at BigTablet. I joined the company in 2025 and have been working hard with our development team ever since. üòÅ

qa2.q: Could you tell us a bit about your role at BigTablet?
qa2.a: I‚Äôm mainly responsible for server development and infrastructure management. In short, I handle most of the backend operations except for frontend development.

qa3.q: You mentioned that you‚Äôre in charge of backend development ‚Äî what exactly does a backend developer do?
qa3.a: Backend development involves working with the data and logic that users don‚Äôt see directly. I build and manage servers, databases, and deployment workflows. To explain it a bit more, backend developers handle everything that happens from the moment a user signs up ‚Äî including logins, data communication, and even security ‚Äî designing, developing, and maintaining the entire system that supports the service.

qa4.q: You and Yerim both graduated from a Meister high school. What made you decide to pursue a career in development?
qa4.a: I‚Äôve always been interested in IT, and since many people around me were developers, I naturally grew curious about the field. Initially, I studied to become an Android app developer, but after discovering backend development, I realized it suited me much better ‚Äî and I really enjoyed it. So I shifted my focus to backend, which turned out to be one of the best decisions I‚Äôve made. After entering Meister High School, I prepared to become a developer, and now I‚Äôm proudly part of BigTablet‚Äôs development team.

qa5.q: What are some of the pros and cons you‚Äôve experienced while working on the development team?
qa5.a: Since I joined in the early development stage, there were times when the basic infrastructure was lacking. Building things from scratch and learning new technologies at the same time was quite challenging. Documentation, in particular, was tough for me ‚Äî as a developer used to coding, creating templates and writing technical documents while developing was a new experience. But through discussions and collaboration with teammates, I‚Äôve been improving both technically and personally. It‚Äôs rewarding to see progress every day and to feel like I‚Äôm putting together a big puzzle piece by piece.

qa6.q: Lastly, what are your personal goals at BigTablet?
qa6.a: My personal growth is important, but I believe it‚Äôs just as crucial for the team and the organization to grow together. I want to keep experimenting with and adopting new technologies, and someday become part of a leading big tech company.

FE.name: Sangmin Park
FE.description: A developer who never stops learning

qa1.q: Hello Sangmin! Could you please introduce yourself briefly?
qa1.a: Hello, I‚Äôm Sangmin Park, a frontend developer at BigTablet.

qa2.q: Could you tell us a bit about your role at BigTablet?
qa2.a: I‚Äôm responsible for visualizing the data analyzed from CCTV footage ‚Äî one of BigTablet‚Äôs core functions ‚Äî and presenting it to users in a clear and intuitive way.

qa3.q: You mentioned that you work on frontend development. What exactly does a frontend developer do?
qa3.a: In our company, I handle all web-related development. One of my main tasks is developing the service that visualizes analysis results from CCTV footage so users can easily understand the data through the web.

qa4.q: You, Yerim, and Gunwoo all graduated from a Meister high school. What inspired you to become a developer?
qa4.a: I first encountered coding during middle school in an information technology class using Scratch. I found the process of thinking through problems and seeing the results of my ideas incredibly rewarding ‚Äî that sense of accomplishment made me want to pursue a career as a developer.

qa5.q: What‚Äôs been the most challenging part of your work so far, and what do you enjoy the most?
qa5.a: Since I‚Äôm currently the only frontend developer, there are times when the workload feels a bit heavy. However, I‚Äôm very grateful for the support I receive from the company and the culture we‚Äôve built ‚Äî where everyone trusts and respects each other‚Äôs work. That positive environment makes it enjoyable to work here.

qa6.q: Finally, what do you hope to achieve at BigTablet, and what kind of developer do you want to become?
qa6.a: My goal is to deliver BigTablet‚Äôs vision and services flawlessly. I find the projects we‚Äôre working on exciting and meaningful, so I want to build them without any issues. In the long run, I want to become a developer who can turn ideas into reality. While it‚Äôs easy to imagine things, bringing those ideas to life is the real challenge ‚Äî and that‚Äôs the kind of developer I aspire to be.
